RACE.RACE_TEXT: SARATOGA RACE 1 7F Dirt CR: 81. Maiden Special Weight Purse 136500. (PURSE $105,000 FOR NON-NYB)(PURSE $105,000 FOR NON-NYB) (UP TO $23,751 NYSBFOA) FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. (Non-Starters For A Claiming Price Of $40,000 Or Less In The Last 3 St arts Preferred).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: PORTAGE stalked the pace on the outside, took the lead passing the seven-sixteenths, dropped from the three path to the two path on the turn, was challenged to her outside before the five-sixteenths pole, turned into upper stretch on even terms for the lead, shook clear inside the three-sixteenths, was put to a right-handed crop while remaining on her inside lead at the furlong marker, continued under the crop until near the sixteenth-pole then was placed under a hand-ride while remaining on her inside lead to the finish but was best. STUNNINGLY settled off the pace, moved out inside the five-eighths pole, was roused late on the backstretch, shifted from the two path to the four path on the turn, chased outside under a right-handed crop in upper stretch, switched to a left-handed crop at the furlong marker and flattened out while well clear for the place. REVOLVING CREDIT broke in and brushed the gate, settled towards the rear, moved in near the nine-sixteenths, was urged along in the two path on the turn and got up for the show while no threat to the top two. SISTER MAHA went to the front, showed the way down the backstretch, was headed at the seven-sixteenths, vied inside on the turn, dropped back near the five-sixteenths and tired. MS. SOLVEIG dropped back on the outside then was urged along at the rear, went four wide on the turn, dropped to the three path into the stretch and was no factor. FEATHERING broke a half-step slow, angled out towards the rear early, moved up in the field then shifted further out around the nine-sixteenths, chased four then three wide early on the turn, made a bid outside the five-sixteenths, turned into upper stretch on even terms for the lead, drifted in while weakening coming to the furlong marker and capitulated. DARK PRINCESS was well placed just off the pace, dropped back quickly near the half-mile pole, faltered along the rail on the turn and retreated.

ENTRY.NAME: Stunningly
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled,mvd out ins5/8,ask1/2,2-4p turn,chased,flattened,clr2nd

ENTRY.NAME: Feathering
ENTRY.COMMENT: off1/2 step slw,angld out,mvd out,4-3p,bid5/16,drift in1/8,wknd

ENTRY.NAME: Dark Princess
ENTRY.COMMENT: well placed,dropped back 1/2,empty rail turn,retreated

ENTRY.NAME: Sister Maha
ENTRY.COMMENT: to front,showed way,headed 7/16,inside turn,drop back5/16,tired

ENTRY.NAME: Revolving Credit
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke in,brshd gate,settled,mvd in4-1/2,2p turn,up for show

ENTRY.NAME: Ms. Solveig
ENTRY.OWNER: Lindy Farms Ice Wine Stable and Greathorse Racing
ENTRY.COMMENT: dropped back outside,urged along,4w turn,3w into lane,no threat

ENTRY.NAME: Portage
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked outside,lead7/16,3-2p turn,shook foe 3/16,ins lead,held

RACE.RACE_TEXT: SARATOGA RACE 2 5 1/2F Dirt CR: 81. Maiden Special Weight Purse 83000. (UP TO $14,442 NYSBFOA) FOR MAIDENS, TWO YEARS OLD. Weight, 119 lbs. (For Horses That Sold or RNA for $50,000 Or Less In Their Most Recent Sale).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: ANTONIO OF VENICE coaxed from the gate, raced three wide off the duel advancing to take command just inside the five-sixteenths, swung three to four wide into upper stretch, edged clear under a drive to prevail. CATIRE VIZCAYA hustled from the gate, dueled from the two path with ASTRONOMICO to his inside coming under coaxing at the three-eighths, continued just off the inside into upper stretch displaced from the front, ran on to chase the winner home willingly for the place honors. HONEST AL coaxed from the start, chased just off the inside under coaxing from the three-eighths, angled three to four wide into upper stretch, improved position to secure the last major share. ASTRONOMICO hustled from the gate, dueled along the inside of CATIRE VIZCAYA coming under coaxing from three furlongs out, cut the corner into upper stretch, weakened in the drive. GROUP TICKET coaxed from the start, chased three to four paths off the inside down the backstretch before tucking inside through the turn, came under coaxing at the three-eighths, angled five wide into upper stretch and trailed.

ENTRY.NAME: Astronomico
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled st, dueled ins, coaxed 3/8, cut corner, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Honest Al
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, chased 2p, coaxed 3/8, 3-4w upper, improved

ENTRY.NAME: Catire Vizcaya
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled st, dueled 2p, coaxed 3/8, 2w 1/4, ran on, willingly

ENTRY.NAME: Antonio of Venice
ENTRY.OWNER: Imperio Michael Cotrone Robert Hibiscus Stables LLC and Rodriguez Rudy R
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, 3w off duel, up ins 5/16, 3-4w upper, edged clear

ENTRY.NAME: Group Ticket
ENTRY.OWNER: Sweezey J Kent and Rossi Dylan
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, chased 3-4w, coaxed ins 3/8, 5w upper, trailed

RACE.RACE_TEXT: SARATOGA RACE 3 5 1/2F Turf CR: 97. Starter Allowance Purse 70000. (UP TO $12,180 NYSBFOA) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE STARTED FOR A CLAIMING PRICE OF $50,000 OR LESS AND WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A RACE OTHER THAN MAIDEN OR CLAIMING. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race In 2023 Allow ed 2 lbs. (If the Stewards consider it inadvisable to run this race on the turf course, this race will be run at Five and One Half Furlongs on the Main Track). (Rail at 12 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: HIGHLY FLAMMABLE dropped to the rear while awkwardly into stride, settled at the tail of the field, went three then four wide on the turn, rallied outside into upper stretch, closed strongly to get the lead inside the furlong marker then kicked clear and maintained a safe advantage under steady handling. SUGAR GRAY LEONARD settled towards the rear, raced between foes in the two path on the turn, jostled with a rival outside the five-sixteenths, was roused near the quarter-pole, bumped with DESTIN'S MISSION while kept in by that foe at the three-sixteenths, waited while blocked from that point to the furlong marker then altered out for room, had the winner get the jump on him in the process, picked up his stride coming to the sixteenth-pole and finished with good energy but lost his best chance at the victory while up for the place. KING JAMES went to the front, showed the way with some company to his outside, vied inside on the turn, was asked under threat at the quarter-pole then came under a drive, lost the advantage to the winner inside the furlong marker and was outfinished then lost the place while just able to get the show. WAR TERMINATOR was well placed just off the pace, saved ground on the turn, jostled with an opponent outside the five-sixteenths, was put to a drive with a clear rail opening in upper stretch, gained to make a brief bid along the rail at the furlong marker but was out-kicked then just missed the show. SANDRONE was urged along while pressing the pace on the outside, drew even with the leader in the two path on the turn, battled side by side with that foe under a drive into the final furlong and weakened. DESTIN'S MISSION brushed with a rival at the start while last away, tracked the pace on the outside, was given his cue in the three path on the turn, bumped with a foe while between horses in upper stretch, dropped back into the final furlong and tired.

ENTRY.NAME: King James
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pressured pace,ins turn,ask1/4,overtaken,lost place

ENTRY.NAME: War Terminator
ENTRY.COMMENT: well plcd,ins,jstld5/16,clear rail opening3/16,bid1/8,out-kicked

ENTRY.NAME: Highly Flammable
ENTRY.COMMENT: awkward into stride,at rear,3-4w turn,rally outside,swept by

ENTRY.NAME: Sandrone
ENTRY.COMMENT: urged along,pressed outside,2path turn,vied past 1/8,weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Sugar Gray Leonard
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled,btwn 2p turn,jstld5/16,bmp3/16,blckd to1/8,alter,gain

ENTRY.NAME: Destin's Mission
ENTRY.COMMENT: brshd brk,last away,tracked outside,ask3w turn,bmp3/16,weakened

RACE.RACE_TEXT: SARATOGA RACE 4 1M Dirt CR: 89. Claiming Purse 64000. (UP TO $11,136 NYSBFOA) FOR FILLIES AND MARES FOUR YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Weight, 123 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races At A Mile Or Over In 2023 Allowed 3 lbs. Such A Race In 2023 Allowed 5 lbs. Claiming Price $32,000 (Maiden And Claiming Races For $25,000 O r Less Not Considered In Allowances) (1.5% Aftercare Assessment Due At Time Of Claim Otherwise Claim Will Be Void).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: PRETTI XTREME four then three wide in pursuit, advanced to take over command at the five-sixteenths, came under coaxing near the quarter pole and swung four wide into upper stretch, went clear under a drive and was geared down in the very late stages. HALO CITY chased three to four wide coming under coaxing at the seven-sixteenths, angled five wide into upper stretch, proved no match for the top one while along clear of the rest and second best. GREATEST LOVE grew detached at the tail of the field and tucked to the two path into the backstretch, came under urging at the three-eighths, continued just off the inside into upper stretch and improved position to secure the show honors. MARIAH'S FORTUNE hustled from the gate, showed the way in hand along the inside, floated to the two path with nine-sixteenths to run, got overhauled by the top one at the five-sixteenths, swung three wide into upper stretch and tired. WITH THIS VOW hustled from the gate, chased two to three wide under coaxing from the three-eighths, swung three to four wide for home, faltered. GOOD PENNY hustled from the start, chased along the inside down the backstretch and then three wide through the far turn coaxed along from the seven-sixteenths, went seven wide into upper stretch, folded, and was eased home to the finish.

ENTRY.NAME: Mariah's Fortune
ENTRY.OWNER: Two B and One C Stable
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled st, in hand ins, to 2p 9/16, yielded 5/16, 3w uppr, tired

ENTRY.NAME: With This Vow
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled st, chased 2-3w, coaxed 3/8, 3-4w upper, faltered

ENTRY.NAME: Pretti Xtreme
ENTRY.COMMENT: 4-3w pursuit, up 5/16, coaxed near 1/4, 4w upper, went clear

ENTRY.NAME: Good Penny
ENTRY.OWNER: Johnston Keith F and Sparks William S
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled st, chased ins, coaxed 3w 7/16, 7w upper, folded, eased

ENTRY.NAME: Halo City
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased 3-4w, coaxed 7/16, 5w upper, no match, 2nd best

ENTRY.NAME: Greatest Love
ENTRY.COMMENT: detached 2p at rear, urged 3/8, 2w 1/4p, improved

RACE.RACE_TEXT: SARATOGA RACE 5 5 1/2F Dirt CR: 80. Maiden Special Weight Purse 83000. (UP TO $14,442 NYSBFOA) FOR MAIDENS, TWO YEARS OLD. Weight, 119 lbs. (For Horses That Sold or RNA for $50,000 Or Less In Their Most Recent Sale).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: CRAZY MASON disputed the pace on the outside, vied in the two then three path on the turn, shook clear coming to the quarter-pole, drew off while remaining on his inside lead in upper stretch, was put to a right-handed crop at the furlong marker, swapped to the proper lead outside the sixteenth-pole just before being given one pop of a left-handed crop and proved much the best under a strong hand-ride from that point to the finish. CROWN THAT SAINT chased the pace down the backstretch, went around the turn in the two path, was roused for more at the quarter-pole, moved out in pursuit of the winner in the stretch and was second best. UNCLE EDDIE disputed the pace on the inside of a rival, vied along the rail on the turn, dropped back coming to the quarter-pole and tired while best of the rest. THREEWHITESOLDIERS was bumped hard at the start, raced on the outside while ridden along, angled in late on the backstretch, saved ground on the turn, moved out into upper stretch and failed to threaten. ROCK STAR BOY was sent hard from the gate, chased the pace on the outside, went three then four wide on the turn, dropped back near the quarter-pole and capitulated. MAYOR JACK broke out and bumped hard with a foe, settled on the outside, moved in leaving the backstretch, raced in the two path for most of the turn then shifted three wide, came five wide into the stretch and failed to respond. BALANCE SHEET had a shoe repaired in the paddock, was last to commence, raced off the pace under urging, went three then four wide on the turn and faltered.

ENTRY.NAME: Crown That Saint
ENTRY.OWNER: Noda Orlando Hablan Los Caballos LLC Signature Thoroughbreds and SEI Ragazzi Rac
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased pace,2path turn,roused for more1/4,second best

ENTRY.NAME: Uncle Eddie
ENTRY.OWNER: Deeb Dennis L and Seery Terence V
ENTRY.COMMENT: pace inside foe,rail turn,dropped back 1/4,tired,best of rest

ENTRY.NAME: Crazy Mason
ENTRY.COMMENT: outside pace,2-3path turn,clear1/4,drew off,steady urging

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Gmbracstables LLC, Mr. & Mrs. RamonRangel & Mr. & Mrs. Zac

ENTRY.NAME: Balance Sheet
ENTRY.COMMENT: shoe repair paddock,last away,urged along,3-4w turn,6w1/4,falter

ENTRY.NAME: Mayor Jack
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke out,bmpd hard,settled outside,mvd in 7/16,2-3p,5w1/4,empty

ENTRY.NAME: Threewhitesoldiers
ENTRY.COMMENT: bmpd hard brk,urged,mvd in 1/2,saved ground,mvd out3/16,no threat

ENTRY.NAME: Rock Star Boy
ENTRY.OWNER: Cotrone Robert and Rodriguez Rudy R
ENTRY.COMMENT: sent hard,chased outside,3-4path turn,empty

RACE.RACE_TEXT: SARATOGA RACE 6 5 1/2F Turf CR: 81. Maiden Special Weight Purse 136500. (PURSE $105,000 FOR NON-NYB) (UP TO $23,751 NYSBFOA) FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES TWO YEARS OLD. Weight, 119 lbs. (Non-Starters For A Claiming Price Of $40,000 Or Less In The Last 3 Starts Preferred). (If the Stewards consider it inadvisable to run this race on the turf course, this race will be run at Five and One Half Furlongs on the Main Track). (Rail at 12 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: KODIAC WINTERGREEN (IRE) coaxed from the gate, tracked just off the inside from mid pack, came under coaxing near the quarter pole, swung three wide into upper stretch, tipped out two paths inside the three-sixteenths forcing DANCING NANCY to pause in behind her and then herding out LAMORNA very slightly before being corrected, rallied into contention a sixteenth from home, then surged late to get up in the last jumps to the finish. EVER SO SWEET (IRE) coaxed from the gate, showed the way in hand along the inside through swift splits coming under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, continued in the inside route into upper stretch, edged clear to the eighth pole, dug in under a drive under late threat, then got overhauled in the final strides by the top one while preserving the place honors on the wire. PARADE RING (IRE) a bit fractious in the gate prior to the start, was backed out and reloaded, chased along the inside just off the pace, came under coaxing near the quarter pole, angled three to four wide into upper stretch, dug in under a drive, then came under a very active right handed rein and came inwards bumping NEOM BEACH solidly off stride just outside the sixteenth marker, came in again, the rider continuing to go to the right handed rein encouragement nearly using it as a crop and brushed with that same foe seventy yards from home before prevailing in the battle for the show honors. LAMORNA got squeezed at the start when IMPUDENCE broke inwards and KODIAC WINTERGREEN held his lane and was away last, chased two to three wide from near the rear of the field coming under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, angled six wide into upper stretch, got slightly herded out as KODIAC WINTERGREEN tipped out along her inside inside the three-sixteenths and then offered up a mild kick to close in late. NEOM BEACH stumbled at the start and was bumped by GEMOFAPERFORMANCE breaking in a step, raced three then two wide in closest aim of the leader, came under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, spun two to three wide into upper stretch, dug in under a drive prominent inside the eighth pole and was bumped solidly by PARADE RING coming in under right handed encouragement, paused briefly absorbing the shock when knocked off stride just outside the sixteenth marker, then got brushed seventy yards from the finish when that same rival continued coming in uncorrected and lost position in the late stages to the wire. GEMOFAPERFORMANCE broke in at the start bumping NEOM BEACH, chased three then two wide, got roused cutting the corner into upper stretch and offered no response. DANCING NANCY two to three wide in pursuit, came under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, swung four wide into upper stretch, paused in behind KODIAC WINTERGREEN when that foe tipped out in front inside the three-sixteenths and stayed on one paced to the end. SAN PANTALEO coaxed from the gate, chased along the inside coming under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, took the inside route into upper stretch and weakened in the late stages. IMPUDENCE broke in at the start squeezing out LAMORNA against KODIAC WINTERGREEN, came under coaxing and chased along the inside, got placed to urging at the five-sixteenths, swung three wide for home and made no headway. RAICHU struck the off side stall at the start, chased three to four wide under coaxing from the five-sixteenths, angled five wide into upper stretch and tired. There was a Stewards' Inquiry into the stretch run focusing on the incident between PARADE RING and NEOM BEACH at the sixteenth pole before the result was allowed to stand and the race was declared official.

ENTRY.NAME: San Pantaleo
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, chased ins, coaxed 5/16, inside 1/4, wknd late

ENTRY.NAME: Parade Ring (IRE)
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased ins, 3-4w upper, came in, bumped foe 1/16, mild kick

ENTRY.NAME: Kodiac Wintergreen (IRE)
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, tracked 2p, 3w uppr, tip out ins 3/16, late surge, up

ENTRY.COMMENT: squeezed st, 2-3w near rear, coaxed 5/16, 6w upper, mild kick

ENTRY.OWNER: Lowwood Farm LLC and Abreu Fernando
ENTRY.COMMENT: brk in, coaxed st, chased ins, coaxed 5/16, 3w upper, no headway

ENTRY.OWNER: LaPenta Robert V and Madaket Stables LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: 2-3w pursuit, coaxed 5/16, 4w upper, paused 3/16, one paced

ENTRY.NAME: Raichu
ENTRY.COMMENT: hit gate st, chased 3-4w, coaxed 5/16, 5w upper, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Neom Beach
ENTRY.COMMENT: stumbled, bumped st, 3-2w in aim, 2-3w uppr, bumped 1/16p

ENTRY.NAME: Gemofaperformance
ENTRY.COMMENT: brk in st, chased 3-2w, cut corner roused, no response

ENTRY.NAME: Ever So Sweet (IRE)
ENTRY.OWNER: Hoffman Gregory M RT Racing Stable and Scherer Clay
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, in hand ins, coaxed 5/16, inside 1/4, clear, caught

RACE.RACE_TEXT: SARATOGA RACE 7 1M Inner turf CR: 97. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 100000. INNER TURF FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD FOALED IN NEW YORK STATE AND APPROVED BY THE NEW YORK STATE-BRED REGISTRY WHICH HAVE NEVER WON $18,000 TWICE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, OR STARTER OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES OR OPTIONAL CLAIMING PRICE O F $45,000. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Other Than Claiming Or Starter At A Mile Or Over In 2023 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race In 2023 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $45,000 (Allowance Horses Preferred)(1.5% Aftercare As sessment Due At Time Of Claim Otherwise Claim Will Be Void). (Rail at 9 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SPIRIT OF ST LOUIS was taken under a tight hold while towards the front early, saved ground under snug restraint around the opening bend, was rated while well placed just off the pace, drafted in the two path on the far turn, was asked while replacing a tiring foe into the stretch, rallied to the lead inside the three-sixteenths and drew clear under steady handling. CALL ME HARRY went to the front, rounded the first turn in the two path while in hand, showed the way down the backstretch, was asked near the seven-sixteenths, vied inside under urging on the far turn, lost the lead to the winner inside the three-sixteenths and proved no match while clear for the place. AGENT CREED was taken back under restraint early then pulled a bit between foes into the first turn, rounded that bend in the two path, was rated while tracking the pace on the outside, traveled three wide on the far turn, was given his cue at the five-sixteenths, chased four wide into upper stretch, came in under a right-handed crop in the vicinity of the furlong marker then switched to a left-handed crop and weakened but held the show. CITIZEN K was hustled from the start then taken in hand, saved ground while reserved off the pace, was roused outside the quarter-pole and lacked the needed response. FRANK'S ART broke in then was corrected by the rider while off a step slow, saved ground under tight restraint on the first turn, lagged at the rear, was roused while inside on the far turn, moved out inside the furlong marker, raced in traffic in the final sixteenth and failed to threaten. CONMAN jostled with a rival nearing the first turn then was taken up in tight between foes, raced three wide on that bend, settled on the outside without the benefit of cover,, went three wide on the far turn, came four wide into the stretch and failed to rally. GRAPE NUTS WARRIOR rounded the first turn in the two path, was reserved on the inside of a foe, traveled around the far turn in the two path, was roused near the quarter-pole then came under a drive in upper stretch, raced between rivals into the final furlong and was no factor. GRADED ON A CURVE went four then three wide on the first turn, settled on the outside, was asked while three then four wide on the far turn, came five wide into the stretch and failed to threaten. GHOST GIANT jostled with a rival early, went three wide on the first turn, stalked the pace on the outside, was asked late on the backstretch, chased in the two path on the final turn, dropped back into upper stretch and capitulated.

ENTRY.NAME: Spirit of St Louis
ENTRY.OWNER: Madaket Stables LLC Dubb Michael and Schermerhorn Richard
ENTRY.COMMENT: tight hold ins1st,rated,well placed,2p2nd,lead ins3/16,drew clear

ENTRY.COMMENT: snug hold2p1st,pace,ask7/16,ins2nd,headed ins3/16,no match,clr2nd

ENTRY.COMMENT: jostled early,tkn up,3p1st,outside,no cover,3w2nd,4w1/4,no rally

ENTRY.NAME: Frank's Art
ENTRY.COMMENT: brk in,bit slw,ins1st,at back,ins2nd,mvd out1/8,traffic,no threat

ENTRY.NAME: Grape Nuts Warrior
ENTRY.COMMENT: 2p1st,reserved ins foe,2p2nd,ask1/4,btwn1/8,no threat

ENTRY.NAME: Ghost Giant
ENTRY.COMMENT: jostled early,3p1st,stlkd outside,ask7/16,chsd 2p2nd turn,empty

ENTRY.NAME: Graded On a Curve
ENTRY.OWNER: Flying B Ranch Cattle Company LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: `4-3w1st,settled outside,ask 3-4w2nd turn,5w1/4,no threat

RACE.RACE_TEXT: SARATOGA RACE 8 7F Dirt CR: 88. Starter Allowance Purse 50000. (UP TO $8,700 NYSBFOA) FOR FILLIES AND MARES FOUR YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE STARTED FOR A CLAIMING PRICE OF $20,000 OR LESS IN 2022 - 2023. Weight, 123 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Other Than Claiming Or Starter In 2023 Allowed 3 lbs. Two Such Rac es In 2023 Allowed 5 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MOSIENKO chased inside briefly before tipping out to the three path down the backstretch, tipped five wide through the far turn coming under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, continued five wide into upper stretch rallying to issue a challenge straightened away, took over with three-sixteenths to go and edged away drifting out despite a right handed crop to prevail kept to task. SHE CAUGHT MY EYE hustled from the gate, prompted the pace three wide, came under coaxing nearing the quarter pole and took over command nearing that station, spun just off the inside into upper stretch, dug in under threat and was collared at the three-sixteenths, ran on to chase the winner home safe for the place honors. KNOW IT ALL AUDREY chased along the inside from just off the pace, came under light coaxing near the five-sixteenths, then had to check out along the rail as SUE ELLEN MISHKIN and SHE CAUGHT MY EYE came slightly inwards, lost about two lengths of ground and position and tipped out to swing four to five wide into upper stretch before tipping an additional three to four paths to the far outside for a clear lane with three-sixteenths to go, then offered up a belated bid showing good courage to secure the show honors. INVALUABLE got bumped at the start by SUE ELLEN MISHKIN, chased four wide coming under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, swung three to four wide into upper stretch and weakened in the late stages. KNOWING GLANCE chased just off the inside coming under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, angled out six to seven wide into upper stretch, weakened in the drive. SUE ELLEN MISHKIN brushed the off side stall at the start breaking outwards and then bumped INVALUABLE, showed the way in hand just off the inside under pressure from SHE CAUGHT MY EYE to the outside, came under coaxing at the three-eighths, yielded the front nearing the quarter pole, took the inside route into upper stretch and faltered. RUVIES IN TIME chased five then four wide coming under coaxing at the half mile pole, swung three to four wide into upper stretch and trailed.

ENTRY.NAME: Mosienko
ENTRY.COMMENT: ins briefly, chased 3w, coax 5w 5/16, 5w uppr, up 3/16, edged clr

ENTRY.NAME: Know It All Audrey
ENTRY.OWNER: Three Player's Stable and Barrera III Oscar S
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased ins, checked near 1/4, 4-5w uppr, tip out 3/16, gd courage

ENTRY.NAME: Knowing Glance
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased 2p, coaxed along 5/16, angled 6-7w upper, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Sue Ellen Mishkin
ENTRY.COMMENT: brush gate, in hand 2p, coaxed 3/8, yielded, ins 1/4, faltered

ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped st, chased 4w, coaxed 5/16, 3-4w upper, wknd late

ENTRY.COMMENT: chased 5-4w, coaxed 1/2p, 3-4w upper, trailed

ENTRY.NAME: She Caught My Eye
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled st, prompted 3w, up near 1/4, 2w 1/4, collared, ran on

RACE.RACE_TEXT: SARATOGA RACE 9 1 1/16M Turf CR: 104. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 156000. (PURSE $120,000 FOR NON-NYB) (UP TO $27,144 NYSBFOA) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON $18,000 TWICE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER OR STATE BRED ALLOWANCE OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES OR OPTIONAL CLAIMING PRICE OF $62,500. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Other Than Claiming Or Starter At A Mile Or Over In 2023 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race In 2023 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $62,500 (Allowance Horses Preferred)(1.5% Aftercare Assessment D ue At Time Of Claim Otherwise Claim Will Be Void). (If the Stewards consider it inadvisable to run this race on the turf course, this race will be run at One Mile on the Main Track). (Rail at 12 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: WHISPER NOT (GB) was asked some from the start, went four wide on the first turn, settled in the back half of the field, moved from three to five wide on the far turn, came six wide into the stretch, rallied outside to make a bid coming to the furlong marker, battled with multiple foes into the final sixteenth, fought with the runner-up to the finish and narrowly prevailed under strong urging. CHASING THE CROWN tucked into the three path into the first turn then dropped to the two path, was reserved towards the rear, traveled around the far turn in the two path while between foes, was roused four wide into the stretch, rallied to make a bid between foes approaching the furlong marker, battled with multiple rivals into the final sixteenth, fought with the winner to the finish and missed while able to get the place. NAPOLEONIC WAR went four wide on the first turn, was reserved on the outside, rounded the far turn in the four path, was roused five wide into the stretch, rallied to make a bid near the furlong marker, battled under a drive into the final sixteenth and was outfinished while just able to get the show. JAMES ALOYSIUS was taken in hand early, went around the first turn in the two path, was rated off the pace, traveled three wide around the far turn, was put to a drive with clear room in front in upper stretch, gained to make a bid nearing the furlong marker, battled under a drive into the final sixteenth and was out-kicked then just missed the show. FULL SCREEN was bumped at the start, became rank under restraint early, saved ground while continuing rank through the first turn, was reserved off the pace while tugging at the bit, went two then three wide on the far turn, swung five wide into the stretch and improved position. ARI GOLD broke out and bumped with a foe, was coaxed along early, saved ground on the first turn, was rated just off the pace in a good position, went around the far turn in the two path, was asked for his best in upper stretch, battled under a drive into the final furlong and tired. SARATOGA FLASH established a forward position early, went around the first turn in the two path, came out onto the backstretch, tossed his head inside the three-quarter pole then bobbled, went three wide on the far turn, battled under a drive into the final furlong and weakened. OCALA DREAM went three wide on the first turn, was rated off the pace, saved ground on the far turn, turned into the stretch in the two path, chased the vanguard into the final furlong and came up empty. LUCKY CURLIN brushed with a rival at the start then was hustled, settled on the inside, dropped back near the nine-sixteenths, saved ground on the far turn, moved out in upper stretch and lacked the needed response. TOUGH TICKETS raced between foes in the two path early on the first turn, shifted three then four wide later on that bend, settled outside without cover on the backstretch, was asked five wide on the far turn, came six wide into the stretch and failed to threaten. EXACT ESTIMATE went three wide on the first turn, was rated on the outside, came under urging while three then four wide on the far turn, chased into upper stretch, was taken in hand while dropping back at the furlong marker and capitulated. PINE KNOLL brushed with a foe at the start then was hustled, contested the pace on the inside, was urged along on the far turn, dropped back into the stretch and faltered.

ENTRY.NAME: Ari Gold
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke out,bmpd,ins1st,rated,well placed,2p2nd turn,chased,wknd

RACE.RACE_TEXT: New York Stallion Series S. SARATOGA RACE 10 1M Inner turf CR: 90. Stakes Purse 150000. INNER TURF FOR THREE YEARS OLD ELIGIBLE FOR THE NEW YORK STALLION STAKES. Non-Lasix race pursuant to 4043.2 (7)(e)(5) Lasix not permitted within 48 hours of post time. Only foals by Nominated Stallions will be eligible for all of the New York Stallion Sta kes Series races. By subscription of $150 each which should accompany the nomination. $750 to pass the entry box and an additional $750 to start. For horses not originally nominated, a supplemental nomination payment of $750 in addition to the entry and starting fees may be made at any time prior to the closing of entries. The purse to be divided 55% to the owner of the winner, 20% to second, 12% to third, 6% to fourth, 4% to fifth and 3% divided equally amongst the remaining finishers. 5% of purses won to be awarded to the stallion nominator. Weight 124 lbs. Non-winners of a sweepstake on the turf allowed 2 lbs.; of two races on the turf other than maiden, claiming or starter allowed 4 lbs.; of a race other than maiden, claiming or starter allowed 6 lb
RACE.FOOTNOTES: ITSALLCOMINTOGETHA coaxed from the gate, showed the way in hand along the inside patiently handled through sensible splits, got set down taking the inside route into upper stretch, edged clear under a drive to the eighth pole, came under challenge inside the final sixteenth, dug in and held well to prevail. RAMBLIN' WRECK tracked the pace just off the inside from mid pack, tucked inside when placed to coaxing at the five-sixteenths, continued in the inside route into upper stretch, dug in under a drive tipping out to nudge VACATION DANCE to the three path in front of WILLINTORISKITALL just outside the eighth pole, then rallied closing well to challenge for it all through the final sixteenth but was ultimately rebuffed at the end. VACATION DANCE coaxed from the gate, tracked the leader in closest aim just off the inside, came under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, spun just off the inside into upper stretch, got nudged by the aforementioned foe tipping out near the eighth pole and weakened in the late stages while just holding for the show honors. WILLINTORISKITALL three wide in pursuit, came under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, continued three wide into upper stretch, got paused in behind VACATION DANCE when that foe was nudged out in front by RAMBLIN' WRECK near the eighth pole, angled inside of VACATION DANCE, then kept on under his own power and was out-finished for the show honors. TWENTY SIX BLACK three wide in pursuit, came under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, swung four wide into upper stretch and offered no response. MAMA BANNED ME broke a beat slow without incident getting away last and quickly growing detached at the tail of the field when sluggish early and under urging, chased two then three wide before tucking inside into the far turn, came under a drive at the three-eighths, angled six wide into upper stretch and trailed throughout.

ENTRY.NAME: Itsallcomintogetha
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, in hand ins, set down ins 1/4, edged clear, held well
